description: System-generated unique identifier for each project status record; used as the primary key and for joins.
Business code or name of the project status used across the application and integrations.
Human-friendly description of the project status shown in user interfaces and reports.
Boolean flag indicating this status is the default assigned to new projects.
Boolean flag to exclude this status from lookup fields and selection lists.
Boolean flag to suppress this status in reports, charts, and dashboards.
Controls whether planned/estimated values can be edited when a project is in this status.
Controls whether actual time, cost, or progress can be updated while in this status.
Indicates the status record is retired/inactive and should not be applied to new projects.
Free-text notes about the status, such as usage guidance or administrative remarks.
Date and time when this status record was last changed by any process or user.
Likely timestamp of the last user-initiated change to this record; confirm with SME due to naming inconsistency.
Identifier of the user who originally created this status record.
Date and time when this status record was created.
Identifier of the user who most recently modified this status record.
Date and time of the most recent user modification to this record.
